intro: Stylidium obtusatum var. rubricalyx, commonly known as the red-veined triggerplant, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking red veins on its narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces vibrant orange or yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique morphology and vivid coloration make it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections.
